creator: hzimmerman
title: Create a movie from stop motion frames in Final Cut Pro X
description: This project provides a method for easily creating a stop motion movie from a series of still frames within Final Cut Pro X.
steps: Create a new project in Final Cut Pro X, ensuring that the project dimensions match the resolution of your still frames.  You can find the resolution of a still frame by selecting it in Finder and pressing Command+I.

Import your still frame images into a new or existing event in Final Cut Pro X. Analysing the images is not required, and using proxy media is acceptable for faster processing. Select all your images to import.
In the browser, select all the imported images by pressing Command+A.  The selected images will be highlighted in yellow.
Add all selected images to the timeline at once by pressing "D". This will overwrite edit them into the timeline. Dragging will work, but may cause an application crash.

Select all the images in the timeline by clicking in the timeline and then pressing Command+A. They should now have yellow outlines. As a default, all still frame images are 2 seconds long. The goal is to adjust all the images to be one frame long.

With all the images selected in the timeline, change the duration of each clip to 1 frame by pressing Control+D, then typing '1', and finally pressing Enter. The images will now be condensed together.

Render the sequence to a new video file by using the menu command File - Share - Master file (default)....In the dialog that opens, be sure to set Format to Video Only, as there is no audio in this stop motion sequence.
